Package com.samysadi.acs.utility.workload.task

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Task
    A task defines a sequence of operations to be executed by a Workload.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AppendFileTask
    Appends the given Size in Simulator.MEBIBYTE to the workload's active file.
    ComputeTask
    Computes for the given Length in Simulator.MI.
    CreateClientJobTask
    Creates a job and places it in one of the current user's ThinClients.
    The created job is defined as the current workload's remote job.
    CreateFileTask
    Creates a file with the given initial Size in Simulator.MEBIBYTE using the cloud provider's Staas.
    CreateJobTask
    Creates a job and places it in one of the current user's VMs.
    The created job is defined as the current workload's remote job.
    DelayTask  
    DeleteFileTask
    Deletes the workload's active file.
    DeployVmTask
    Deploys (ie: creates and places) the given Count of VirtualMachines.
    FreeRamTask
    Frees a maximum of the given Size in Simulator.MEBIBYTE in the Ram.
    LogTask
    Logs a message to output.
    ProbeDecrementTask  
    ProbeIncrementTask  
    ProbeSetValueTask  
    ReadFileTask
    Reads a maximum of the given Size in Simulator.MEBIBYTE starting at the given Pos (ie: offset in Simulator.MEBIBYTE) from the workload's active file.
    If the size / offset overflows then the overflowing size is ignored.
    SelectRandomFileInCloudTask
    Selects a random file (between all files in the cloud) and defines it as the workload's active file.
    SelectRandomFileTask
    Selects a random file (between all user's files) and defines it as the workload's active file.
    TaskImpl  
    WriteFileTask
    Writes a maximum of the given Size in Simulator.MEBIBYTE starting at the given Pos (ie: offset in Simulator.MEBIBYTE) in the workload's active file.
    If the size / offset overflows then the overflowing size is ignored.
    WriteRamTask
    Writes a maximum of the given Size in Simulator.MEBIBYTE starting at the given Pos (ie: offset in Simulator.MEBIBYTE) in the Ram.
    The Pos configuration can be omitted, in which case it is assumed to be the last modified index from last call to this method (or 0 if it's the first call, or if the end of the ram is reached).
